appDisabled.description: True if this add-on cannot be used in the application based on version compatibility, dependencies, and blocklisting. This field is only available after the 'sessionstore-windows-restored' topic is notified.

blocklisted.description: Whether or not the add-on appears in the blocklist. This field is only available after the 'sessionstore-windows-restored' topic is notified.

foreignInstall.description: True or false depending on whether the add-on is a third party add-on installation or not. This field is only available after the 'sessionstore-windows-restored' topic is notified.

hasBinaryComponents.description: True or false depending on whether the add-on has binary components. This is always false since Firefox 60. This field is only available after the 'sessionstore-windows-restored' topic is notified.

installDay.description: The days since epoch that the add-on was first installed. This field is only available after the 'sessionstore-windows-restored' topic is notified.

isSystem.description: Whether or not the add-on is a system add-on. This field is available at startup.

isWebExtension.description: Whether or not the add-on is a WebExtension add-on. This field is available at startup.

multiprocessCompatible.description: Whether or not the add-on is a compatible with e10s. Since Firefox 61, this is always true. This field is available at startup.

name.description: The add-on name, limited to 100 characters. This field is only available after the 'sessionstore-windows-restored' topic is notified.

scope.description: Indicates what scope the add-on is installed in, per profile, user, system, or application. This field is available at startup.

signedState.description: The state of the signature of the add-on. This field is only available after the 'sessionstore-windows-restored' topic is notified.

updateDay.description: The day the add-on was last updated. This field is optional, but available at startup if present.

userDisabled.description: Whether or not the user disabled the add-on. This field is only available after the 'sessionstore-windows-restored' topic is notified.

version.description: The version of the add-on. This field is available at startup.

persona.description: The id of the active persona (theme).

appDisabled.description: True if this theme cannot be used in the application based on version compatibility, dependencies, and blocklisting.

blocklisted.description: Whether or not the theme appears in the blocklist.

foreignInstall.description: True or false depending on whether the theme is a third party theme installation or not.

hasBinaryComponents.description: True or false depending on whether the theme has binary components. This is always false since Firefox 60.

installDay.description: The days since epoch that the theme was first installed.

name.description: The theme name, limited to 100 characters.

scope.description: Indicates what scope the theme is installed in, per profile, user, system, or application.

updateDay.description: The day the theme was last updated.

userDisabled.description: Whether or not the user disabled the theme.

architecture.description: The build architecture for the active build.

architecturesInBinary.description: For Mac universal builds, this is a string containing a list of architectures delimited by '-'. Architecture sets are always in the same order: ppc > i386 > ppc64 > x86_64 > (future additions). This is only available on Mac.

buildId.description: The build ID/date of the application.

displayVersion.description: The display version of the application.

platformVersion.description: The version of the XULRunner platform.

updaterAvailable.description: True if the application was built with the support for the updater component.

xpcomAbi.description: A string tag identifying the binary ABI of the current processor and compiler vtable. This is taken from the TARGET_XPCOM_ABI configure variable. It may not be available on all platforms, especially unusual processor or compiler combinations. The result takes the form <processor>-<compilerABI>, for example: x86-msvc, ppc-gcc3, ... . This value should almost always be used in combination with  the 'OS'.

distributionId.description: The value of the `distribution.id` pref that identifies the Firefox distribution.

partnerNames.description: The list of names from the `app.partner` children prefs, as `app.partner.<name>=<name>`.

creationDate.description: The creation date of the user profile as the integer number of days since UNIX epoch.

resetDate.description: The date the user profile was reset, as the integer number of days since UNIX epoch. This is optional.

addonCompatibilityCheckEnabled.description: Whether application compatibility is respected for add-ons.

campaign.description: Identifier of the particular campaign that led to the download of the product.

content.description: Identifier to indicate the particular link within a campaign.

medium.description: Category of the source, such as 'organic' for a search engine.

source.description: Referring partner domain, when install happens via a known partner.

blocklistEnabled.description: True if the blocklist is enabled.

defaultSearchEngine.description: Contains the string identifier or name of the default search engine provider. Deprecated.

loadPath.description: The anonymized path of the engine xml file, e.g. e.g. jar:[app]/omni.ja!browser/engine.xml (where ‘browser’ is the name of the chrome package, not a folder) [profile]/searchplugins/engine.xml [distribution]/searchplugins/common/engine.xml [other]/engine.xml [other]/addEngineWithDetails [other]/addEngineWithDetails:extensionID [http/https]example.com/engine-name.xml [http/https]example.com/engine-name.xml:extensionID

name.description: The name of the default search engine.

origin.description: The origin of the search engine: the value will be default for engines that are built-in or from distribution partners, verified for user-installed engines with valid verification hashes, unverified for non-default engines without verification hash, and invalid for engines with broken verification hashes.

submissionURL.description: The HTTP url we would use to search. For privacy, we don’t record this for user-installed engines.

e10sEnabled.description: True if the E10S is enabled.

e10sMultiProcesses.description: maximum number of processes that will be launched for regular web content

fissionEnabled.description: whether fission is enabled this session, and subframes can load in a different process

isDefaultBrowser.description: Identifier to indicate the particular link within a campaign.

locale.description: The best locale that the application should be localized to.

effectiveContentProcessLevel.description: The effective sandbox. The values are OS dependent.

channel.description: The update channel from the defaults only. Does not include the partner bits.

appleModelId.description: The model IDs for Apple desktop devices. This is Mac only.

cores.description: The number of physical CPU cores. Desktop only, e.g. 4, or `null` on failure.

count.description: The number of logical CPUs. Desktop only, e.g. 8, or `null` on failure.

extensions.description: This lists the avaible CPU extensions as strings. E.g.: 'hasMMX', 'hasSSE', 'hasSSE2', 'hasSSE3', 'hasSSSE3', 'hasSSE4A', 'hasSSE4_1', 'hasSSE4_2', 'hasAVX', 'hasAVX2', 'hasAES', 'hasEDSP', 'hasARMv6', 'hasARMv7', 'hasNEON'.

family.description: The CPU family, `null` on failure. Desktop only.

l2cacheKB.description: The CPU L2 cache size in KB. `null` on failure. Desktop only.

l3cacheKB.description: The CPU L3 cache size in KB. `null` on failure. Desktop only.

model.description: The CPU model, `null` on failure. Desktop only.

speedMHz.description: Only available on Firefox desktop. The CPU clock speed in MHz.

stepping.description: The CPU stepping, `null` on failure. Desktop only.

vendor.description: The CPU vendor, e.g. 'GenuineIntel', or `null` on failure. Desktop only.

ContentBackend.description: The name of the content backend.

D2DEnabled.description: Whether or not Direct2D is enabled. This is Windows only.

DWriteEnabled.description: Whether or not DirectWrite is enabled. This is Windows only.

EmbeddedInFirefoxReality.description: Whether or not Firefox desktop is embedded by Firefox Reality. This is Windows only.

compositor.description: The name of the compositor. This is one of 'd3d9', 'd3d11', 'opengl', 'basic', or 'none' ('none' indicates no compositors have been created).

blacklisted.description: Indicates whether the d3d11 compositor was blocklisted due to driver bugs. (This field was renamed to blocklisted in bug 1647225).

blocklisted.description: Indicates whether the d3d11 compositor was blocklisted due to driver bugs. (This field replaces blacklisted as of bug 1647225).

omtp.description: Indicates whether the off-main-thread painting is enabled.

wrSoftware.description: Indicates whether the software backend to WebRender is enabled.

model.description: The model of the hdd where the application binaries are located. This is Windows only.

revision.description: The revision of the hdd where the application binaries are located. This is Windows only.

model.description: The model of the hdd where the profile directory is located. This is Windows only.

revision.description: The revision of the hdd where the profile directory is located. This is Windows only.

model.description: The model of the hdd where the system files are located. This is Windows only.

revision.description: The revision of the hdd where the system files are located. This is Windows only.

isWow64.description: The availability of the WoW64 subsystem. This is Windows only.

hasPrefetch.description: Whether or not the OS-based prefetch application start-up optimization is set. This is Windows-only. `null` on failure.

hasSuperfetch.description: Whether or not the OS-based superfetch application start-up optimization service is running and using the default settings. This is Windows-only. `null` on failure.

installYear.description: The year Windows was installed. This is Windows only. `null` on failure.

kernelVersion.description: The kernel version of Android. This is Android only. `null` on failure.

locale.description: The locale of the OS, e.g. 'en'. This is `null` on failure.

name.description: The name of the OS, e.g. 'Windows_NT'. This is `null` on failure.

servicePackMajor.description: The Windows service pack major version. This is Windows only. `null` on failure.

servicePackMinor.description: The Windows service pack minor version. This is Windows only. `null` on failure.

version.description: The version of the OS, e.g. '6.1'. This is `null` on failure.

windowsBuildNumber.description: The Windows build number. This is Windows only. `null` on failure.

windowsUBR.description: The Windows UBR. This is Windows 10 only. `null` on failure.

antispyware.description: The name of the registered antispyware software. Windows only.

antivirus.description: The name of the registered antivirus software. Windows only.

firewall.description: The name of the registered firewall software. Windows only.

virtualMaxMB.description: Total virtual memory size in MB. This is Windows only. `null` on failure.

audioTime.description: Time in milliseconds of the recording
audioTime.title: Amount of spoken time

deepSpeechMatches.title: Did the DeepSpeech transcription match with Google's?

deepSpeechServerTime.description: Milliseconds for the DeepSpeech transcription to complete and respond
deepSpeechServerTime.title: Response time of DeepSpeech server

extensionInstallDate.title: Timestamp when the extension was installed

extensionInstallationChannel.description: Where the user first installed the extension (e.g., internal_beta, external_beta, etc)
extensionInstallationChannel.title: First install channel

extensionTemporaryInstall.description: When the extension is installed locally for development, this will be true
extensionTemporaryInstall.title: Temporary Install?

hasCard.title: Does the intent produce a card-like output?

inputLength.title: Number of characters in text/voice input

inputTyped.title: Was the input typed on the keyboard?

intent.title: Full name of the intent handler

intentExtensionId.description: If intent was handled by another extension, the id of that extension
intentExtensionId.title: ID of second extension that handled intent

intentExtensionVersion.description: The self-reported title of an extension that handled the intent
intentExtensionVersion.title: Title of second extension

intentExtraData.description: A specific intent can add information here about how it interepreted the command
intentExtraData.title: Ad hoc intent-specific data

intentFallback.description: True if we couldn't parse the intent to some exact handler, and just fell back on something generic like search
intentFallback.title: Was this a fallback intent handler?

intentId.title: A unique random ID specific to this intent execution

intentServiceName.description: If an intent used some external service, what service did it choose?
intentServiceName.title: What service did the intent handler use?

intentSuccess.description: This is the self-reported success of the intent handler
intentSuccess.title: Was the intent action successful?

intentTime.description: Milliseconds between getting the utterance and execution the intent
intentTime.title: Time to execute the intent

internalError.title: If there was an unexpected error, the name of that error

localHour.description: The hour, 0-23, in the local timezone when the action was run
localHour.title: Local hour of action

numberOfOpenTabs.description: A count of the number of tabs in all windows, that are open when the tool is activated
numberOfOpenTabs.title: Number of open tabs

optInAcceptanceTime.title: The timestamp when the user accepted the opt-in

optInAudio.title: Has the user opted in to audio?

serverErrorIntentParser.description: Error with the server intent parser
serverErrorIntentParser.title: DEPRECATED

serverErrorSpeech.title: Error with the server speech-to-text parser

serverTimeIntentParser.description: Time in milliseconds for server intent parsing
serverTimeIntentParser.title: DEPRECATED

serverTimeSpeech.title: Time in milliseconds for server TTS

siteCategoryOpened.title: Category of site opened by intent

siteCategoryTriggering.description: This only set if the intent dependent on the current tab in some way
siteCategoryTriggering.title: Category of site of active tab when started

utterance.description: This is the actual text the user spoke
utterance.title: Text utterance by user

utteranceDeepSpeechChars.title: Number of characters in DeepSpeech transcription

utteranceParsed.description: Typically the slots found in the utterance
utteranceParsed.title: Parsed form of the utterance

wakewordEnabled.title: Has the user enabled the wakeword?

wakewordUsed.title: Did the user start the intent with a wakeword, and what wakeword?
